data.author: davidgray Photography

changelog.release_notes:
- Fixed timezone issue on main screen (was showing UTC instead of current timezone)
- Added highest probability to the main screen / raw values screen, so you can see highest viewing probability worldwide
v0.93 - Changed API URL to match new location
v0.91 - Optimizations. Should load quicker now, due to some API changes on the server end.
v0.9 - Made breaking changes to API. Updated watchapp to use new format. Also uses calculated probability instead of uncalculated probability

v0.8 - Added "Sighting probability" feature. This value gives tells you your chances of seeing an aurora directly overhead. In order to know how likely you are to see one on the horizon, use the Auroras.live app or website.

v0.7 - All data (gauges, weather and three day Kp forecast) now downloaded on app load. Previously, gauges and weather were downloaded on load, then three day Kp forecast was loaded when the menu was accessed
v0.6 - Added colour to the gauges to better resemble the website and app. Also tweaked the three day forecast for better readability
v0.5 - Bugfixes for the weather (as yr.no has now migrated to met.no), also added in fancy new colour logo!

Version 0.2:

* Redesign of menus
* All times now in your local timezone instead of UTC
* Fixes for broken 3 day forecast menu
* Fixes for broken sun / moon / rise / set times
* Added in preliminary timeline support (not yet active)

data.description:
Auroras.live provides up to date, at a glance information for aurora hunters. If you've ever wanted to view the northern or southern lights, auroras.live can give you the information you need.

The auroras.live watch app takes this one step further and gives you this information on your wrist, showing you three day aurora forecasts on your timeline, weather for your current location updated every minute and a a probability that you'll see an aurora!

The app makes use of the timeline, so you'll receive notifications on upcoming high-Kp periods half an hour before they happen, so you have time to grab your camera and go!

If you want even more information, be sure to check out the Auroras.live apps for iOS, Android and desktop, available at : http://app.auroras.live
data.title: Auroras.live
